object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.overview: An opinion piece that criticises many Democrats and their initiatives. Packed to the brim with Name Calling and Biased Wording. The tried-and-true "Democrat" as an adjective makes a couple of appearances as well as some extreme Selective Quoting.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.title: The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: If you find it difficult to grasp how a handful of leftwing extremists managed to win last week’s battle with the nominal leadership

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: ...alleged leaders fail to rein in their own cadre of fanatical leftists, the core of which consists of recently elected social justice warriors...

property.rebuttal: Is this whole article going to be nothing but name calling? "alleged leaders", "fanatical leftists", "social justice warriors". Even "cadre" sounds sinister here.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Majority Leader Steny Hoyer may not hold enough sway over their own caucus to prevent it from self-destructing.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: Before their epic defeat in 1994, the Democrats held the House majority for no fewer than four decades. Yet, after 12 years in the wilderness, they clearly had learned nothing.

property.rebuttal: Not just in the "minority", but in the "wilderness"?

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: H.R.1, literally gives illegal immigrants the vote.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: The Democrat majority jammed that bill ... through

property.rebuttal: No support provided for "jamming", and "jamming a bill through" is classic Spin...a bill requires a majority vote to pass, and that's what it got.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.rebuttal: In order "for the people" to be ironic, the bill would need to be something that's essentially "against the people". The title may be mislead, inaccurate, unfair, or whatever, but it's not ironic.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: It would vitiate the accuracy of registration rolls by automatically registering anyone who acquires a driver’s license, prevent election officials from verifying voter eligibility, and render state voter ID laws null and void. H.R.1 also takes the power to draw congressional districts away from the states, and requires inclusion of illegal aliens in all redistricting plans.

property.rebuttal: I believe those are all lies. Here's how a fact-checking site [[https://www.factcheck.org/2019/03/misinformation-follows-house-approval-of-h-r-1/]] describes the changes in the bill: make Election Day a federal holiday; require states to automatically register eligible voters; compel states to create independent commissions to oversee redistricting; implement campaign-finance and election-security changes; and require presidential and vice presidential candidates to release 10 years of tax returns.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: then the Democrats would get down to implementing their socialist agenda in earnest.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: Dubbed “Medicare for All,” it will eliminate all private and employer health plans, and come with an annual price tag of $3.3 trillion. It will allegedly save us money

property.rebuttal: Interesting how "dubbed" sounds here, compared to just "named" or "called". The specific annual price tag is stated, but not only are the savings not stated, they are only "allegedly". Note how this would read if things were reversed, and the savings were stated as, say, "$4.1 trillion" while the price tag is presented as simply "allegedly will cost money".

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote:
Yet even the Washington Post confesses:
The public piece of the American health-care system has not proven itself to be particularly cost-efficient. On a per capita basis, U.S. government health programs alone spend more than Canada, Australia, France and Britain… expanding Medicare to all would not automatically result in a radically more efficient health-care system.

property.rebuttal:
"confesses", not "notes" or even "concedes".
Severe Selective Quoting here. The "..." excludes: "each do on their entire health systems. That means the U.S. government spends more per American to cover a slice of the population than other governments spend per citizen to cover all of theirs. Simply", which makes it clear that the quote is pointing out that it's saying that the additional cost of covering everybody means that MFA will still be expensive because it will not cover all those additional people, even though it really would be more efficient.
Had the author included the full quote, his whole argument would be undermined.
Note also that the author also deceptively managed to cut out the word "Simply", as in "Simply Simply expanding Medicare to all would not automatically result in a radically more efficient health-care system. Something else would have to change." And the quoted article proceeds to advocate for additional changes. But cutting out "simply" and the rest of the sentence, the author is making it seem like the article is saying nearly the opposite of what it's actually saying.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: Not coincidentally the latest version of this pie-in-the-sky plan was introduced in late February by one of the above-named Social Justice Warriors, Pramila Jayapal. It boasts 100 Democrat co-sponsors,

property.rebuttal: "Pie-in-the-sky", "Social Justice Warriors". More biased wording and name calling. And "Democrat co-sponsors", not "Democratic...", the all-time classic name-calling favorite.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: The Green New Deal is not, as most people seem to think, a plan conceived by Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and her staff to save the planet. It is, in fact, a program concocted by the Justice Democrats...

property.rebuttal: Just the fact that it was "concocted" rather than "conceived" makes it wound terrible.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: one of its founders was none other than Saikat Chakrabarti, AOC’s chief of staff, who is facing scrutiny by the Federal Election Commission

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.quote: a new generation of Democrat grifters.

object.name: Articles.The Dems Will Lose the House in 2020.WebHome

property.rebuttal: I haven't heard "travelers" as a put-down before, and I don't see how it works, but I'm assuming it must be a pejorative. Perhaps it's a stand-in for "gypsy"?
